00018 namespace BulletHell.Game.Library.Behavior
00019 {
00020     public class ShootingBehavior : Behavior
00021     {
00022         private float xDistance = 0; // positive = hero is left of parent
00023         private float yDistance = 0; // negative = hero is in front of parent
00024 
00025         private BehaviorState lastShooting;
00026 
00027         public ShootingBehavior(EnemyPlaneObj parent)
00028             : base(parent)
00029         {
00030             behaviorState = BehaviorState.Shoot;
00031         }
00032 
00033         public override Behavior clone(EnemyPlaneObj newParent)
00034         {
00035             return new ShootingBehavior(newParent);
00036         }
00037 
00038         private void shoot(Map map, GameTime gameTime)
00039         {
00040             PlaneObj target = map.hero;
00041             Behavior behavior = null;
00042 
00043             /* h = hero; 1 = parent is at this location and uses first the if statement, 2  the second
00044              * -------------
00045              * | h | h | h |
00046              * +---+---+---+
00047              * | 1 | 2 | 1 |
00048              * +---+---+---+
00049              * | 1 | 2 | 1 |
00050              * -------------
00051              */
00052             if (yDistance > _GLOBAL.Viewport.Height / 6) // hero is in the back
00053             {
00054                 if (xDistance > _GLOBAL.Viewport.Width / 6 || xDistance < -_GLOBAL.Viewport.Width / 3) // hero is left or right
00055                 {
00056                     behavior = firstBehaviorfirstGet(parent.Behaviors,
00057                         BehaviorState.ShootCircle,
00058                         BehaviorState.ShootTarget,
00059                         BehaviorState.ShootStraightAngle,
00060                         BehaviorState.ShootStraight);
00061                     if (_GLOBAL.Debug) Console.WriteLine("top left/right");
00062                 }
00063                 else // hero is in range
00064                 {
00065                     behavior = firstBehaviorfirstGet(parent.Behaviors,
00066                         BehaviorState.ShootStraightAngle,
00067                         BehaviorState.ShootCircle,
00068                         BehaviorState.ShootTarget,
00069                         BehaviorState.ShootStraight);
00070                     if (_GLOBAL.Debug) Console.WriteLine("top mid");
00071                 }
00072             }
00073 
00074             /* h = hero; 1 = parent is at this location and uses first the if statement, 2  the second
00075              * -------------
00076              * |   |   |   |
00077              * +---+---+---+
00078              * |h1 |h2 |h1 |
00079              * +---+---+---+
00080              * |   |   |   |
00081              * -------------
00082              */
00083             else if (yDistance <= _GLOBAL.Viewport.Height / 3 && yDistance >= -_GLOBAL.Viewport.Height / 6) // hero is within range
00084             {
00085                 if (xDistance > _GLOBAL.Viewport.Width / 6 || xDistance < -_GLOBAL.Viewport.Width / 6) // hero is left or right
00086                 {
00087                     behavior = firstBehaviorfirstGet(parent.Behaviors,
00088                         BehaviorState.ShootTarget,
00089                         BehaviorState.ShootStraightAngle,
00090                         BehaviorState.ShootCircle,
00091                         BehaviorState.ShootStraight);
00092                     if (_GLOBAL.Debug) Console.WriteLine("mid left/right");
00093                 }
00094                 else
00095                 {
00096                     behavior = firstBehaviorfirstGet(parent.Behaviors,
00097                         BehaviorState.ShootCircle,
00098                         BehaviorState.ShootStraight,
00099                         BehaviorState.ShootStraightAngle,
00100                         BehaviorState.ShootTarget);
00101                     if (_GLOBAL.Debug) Console.WriteLine("mid mid");
00102                 }
00103             }
00104 
00105             /* h = hero; 1 = parent is at this location and uses first the if statement, 2  the second
00106              * -------------
00107              * | 1 | 2 | 1 |
00108              * +---+---+---+
00109              * | 1 | 2 | 1 |
00110              * +---+---+---+
00111              * | h | h | h |
00112              * -------------
00113              */
00114 
00115             else if (yDistance < -_GLOBAL.Viewport.Height / 6) // hero is in the front
00116             {
00117                 if (xDistance > _GLOBAL.Viewport.Width / 6 || xDistance < -_GLOBAL.Viewport.Width / 6) // hero is left or right
00118                 {
00119                     behavior = firstBehaviorfirstGet(parent.Behaviors,
00120                         BehaviorState.ShootTarget,
00121                         BehaviorState.ShootStraightAngle,
00122                         BehaviorState.ShootCircle,
00123                         BehaviorState.ShootStraight);
00124                     if (_GLOBAL.Debug) Console.WriteLine("bot left/right");
00125                 }
00126                 else
00127                 {
00128                     behavior = firstBehaviorfirstGet(parent.Behaviors,
00129                         BehaviorState.ShootStraight,
00130                         BehaviorState.ShootCircle,
00131                         BehaviorState.ShootStraightAngle,
00132                         BehaviorState.ShootTarget);
00133                     if (_GLOBAL.Debug) Console.WriteLine("bot mid");
00134                 }
00135             }
00136 
00137             if (behavior != null)
00138             {
00139                 behavior.Update(map, gameTime);
00140                 lastShooting = behavior.behaviorState;
00141             }
00142         }
00143 
00144         internal override void Update(Map map, GameTime gameTime)
00145         {
00146             xDistance = (parent.X - map.hero.X);
00147             yDistance = (parent.Y - map.hero.Y);
00148 
00149             shoot(map, gameTime);
00150         }
00151     }
00152 }
